register.description: IP Revision Identifier (X.Y.R) Used by software to track features, bugs, and compatibility

bitfield.description: Module ID field
RTL revision. Will vary depending on release.
Major revision
Minor revision

register.description: The DMAENABLE_SET register allows the enabling of DMA requests

bitfield.description: enable DMA reguest FIFO1
enable DMA reguest FIFO0

register.description: The DMAENABLE_CLR register allows the disabling of DMA requests

bitfield.description: clears the enable of the DMA reguest FIFO1. Disables DMA request when writing 1
clears the enable of the DMA reguest FIFO0. Disables DMA request when writing 1

register.description: Controls various parameters of the cotroller state.

bitfield.description: Functional safety debug mode. =1 choose ADCREFP, =0 VMID reference input to ADC
Functional safety debug mode. enable fixed reference to ADC for testing
1 steps are preempted
1 = hw events enabled
AFE powered down
AFE select bias control
writing 1 will store the stepid number with the captured adc data in the fifo

ADC12_SS module enable bit. After programming all the configuration and step enable registers, write a 1 to this bit to start conversion. Writing a 0 will disable the module after the current conversion. Before turning on again, the ADC_SEQUENCER_STATUS register show read back STEP_ID=Idle and FSM_BUSY=0. Enabling the controller will be held off until mem_init_done =1.

register.description: SW can read this register to find out the currently scheduled step id being converted on the ADC port. If you want to turn the controller off and then back on, the step_id bit should be checked and compared to IDLE before enabling the ADC12_SS module again. Also, before enabling the controller again, the user should wait for the FSM bit 5 to read idl.

bitfield.description: Monitor the AFE internal calibration, busy bit
status of ram initialization, 1= ram initialization to 0 after reset is done.
status of fsm, 1= conversion in progress
10000 = idle, 000000 -> 01111 corresponds to step 1 -> step 16

register.description: This feature requires the range check interrupt bit to be enabled first. The user can decide which channel input is compared by programming the RangeCheck bit of the StepConfig Registers. It is up to software to sort through FIFO data to determine which channel data was out of range. Software should only use LSB 10 bits for comparison and make sure bits 11,12 are 0.

bitfield.description: If the sampled data is > value, then interrupt is generated
If the sampled data is < value, then interrupt is generated

register.description: Spare inputs of the AFE are driven by this register, spare outputs from the AFE are read.

bitfield.description: Spare outputs from AFE
Spare inputs to AFE

register.description: Contains the enable bit for each step in the sequencer. When all steps are disabled, the FSM will stay in IDLE state. These bits can be enabled or disabled dynamically during operation. When a write to this register occurs during operational mode, the HW will make sure the new settings are updated after the END_OF_SEQUENCE event

bitfield.description: Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step
Enable step

register.description: FIFO word count status

bitfield.description: number of words in the FIFO

register.description: FIFO threshold

bitfield.description: Program the desired FIFO0 data sample level minus 1 to reach before generating interrupt to CPU

register.description: dma request.

bitfield.description: Number of words minus 1 in FIFO0 before generating a DMA request

register.description: FIFO word count status

bitfield.description: number of words in the FIFO

register.description: FIFO threshold

bitfield.description: Program the desired FIFO1 data sample level minus 1 to reach before generating interrupt to CPU

register.description: dma request.

bitfield.description: Number of words minus 1 in FIFO1 before generating a DMA request

register.description: A read from this register will auto increment the FIFO read pointer. If you read when FIFO is empty,it will trigger an underflow interrupt

bitfield.description: Optional ID tag of channel that captured the data. If tag option is disabled, these bits will be 0
sampled ADC converted data value stored in FIFO

register.description: A read from this register will auto increment the FIFO read pointer. If you read when FIFO is empty,it will trigger an underflow interrupt

bitfield.description: Optional ID tag of channel that captured the data. If tag option is disabled, these bits will be 0
sampled ADC converted data value stored in FIFO

register.description: The End of Interrupt (EOI) MISC Register allows the CPU to acknowledge completion of an interrupt by writing to the EOI for MISC interrupt sources. An eoi_write signal will be generated and another interrupt will be triggered if interrupt sources remain. This register will be reset one cycle after it has been written to.

bitfield.description: Write 0 to flag End Of Interrupt.

register.description: The IRQ_STATUS_RAW register allows the adc12 interrupt sources to be manually set when writing a 1 to a specific bit. Write 0: No action Write 1: Set event Read 0: No event pending Read 1: Event pending

bitfield.description: sample out of range
fifo under flow
fifo over flow
fifo thresholds met
fifo under flow
fifo over flow
fifo thresholds met
end of sequence
eoc from the analog front end missing at expected time after soc

register.description: The IRQ_STATUS register allows the adc12 interrupt sources to be manually cleared when writing a 1 to a specific bit. Write 0: No action Write 1: Clear event Read 0: No event pending Read 1: Event pending

bitfield.description: sample out of range
fifo under flow
fifo over flow
fifo thresholds met
fifo under flow
fifo over flow
fifo thresholds met
end of sequence
eoc from the analog front end missing at expected time after soc

register.description: The IRQ_ENABLE_SET register allows the adc12 interrupt sources to be manually enabled when writing a 1 to a specific bit. Write 0: No action Write 1: Enable event Read 0: Event is disabled Read 1: Event is enabled

bitfield.description: sample out of range
fifo under flow
fifo over flow
fifo thresholds met
fifo under flow
fifo over flow
fifo thresholds met
end of sequence
eoc from the analog front end missing at expected time after soc

register.description: The IRQ_ENABLE_CLR register allows the adc12 interrupt sources to be manually disabled when writing a 1 to a specific bit. Write 0: No action Write 1: Disable event Read 0: Event is disabled Read 1: Event is enabled

bitfield.description: sample out of range
fifo under flow
fifo over flow
fifo thresholds met
fifo under flow
fifo over flow
fifo thresholds met
end of sequence
eoc from the analog front end missing at expected time after soc

register.description: The user should write to this register the values of the input pins send to the AFE during step 1. the StepConfig WriteEnable bit should be set to 1 before a write can occur.

bitfield.description: 0 = no range sel 1 = compare ADC data with range
Sampled data will be stored in FIFO0 when = 0, FIFO1 when = 1
Differential control. Single ended when = 0, differential input when = 1
SEL_INP pins SW configuration
SEL_INM pins, negative differential
000 -> no average 001 -> 2 samples average 010 -> 4 samples average 011 -> 8 samples average 100 -> 16 samples average
00 SW enabled one shot 01 SW enabled continuous 10 HW synchronized one-shot 11 HW synchronized continuous

register.description: Controls number of clock periods to sample and delay

bitfield.description: number of ADC clock cycles to sample. Any value programmed here will be added to the minimum requirement of 1 clock cycle.
Program the number of ADC clock cycles to wait after applying the step configuration registers and before sending the start of ADC conversion

register.description: The user should write to this register the values of the input pins send to the AFE during step 1. the StepConfig WriteEnable bit should be set to 1 before a write can occur.
